data.title: Celebrities, politicians and athletes who call North Jersey home
authors: Jessica Presinzano and Jessica Presinzano, North Jersey Media Group
data.meta_description: Bergen, Essex, Passaic and Morris counties feature dozens of celebrities who were born and raised in North\u00a0Jersey.
data.text:
Bergen abounds with celebrities from the arts, politics and professional sports athletes, but so do Essex, Passaic and Morris counties. Here's a star-studded list of celebrities who were born and raised in North Jersey.

Alpine

Past and present residents of the borough include actors Wesley Snipes and Chris Rock, former Mets and Yankees slugger Gary Sheffield, Baltimore Ravens’ Chris Canty, former New York Knicks center Patrick Ewing, Yankees pitcher CC Sabathia and actor Michael Nouri. Musical talent Stevie Wonder and hip-hop artist P. Diddy also make the list.

Belleville

Belleville claims Frank Iero, rhythmn guitarist of My Chemical Romance, as a native.

Bergenfield

Esteemed jazz guitarist Al DiMeola grew up in Bergenfield.

Bogota

Vin Scully, sportscaster known as the play-by-play voice of the Brooklyn and Los Angeles Dodgers baseball teams, lived here.

Cliffside Park

The borough has had its fair share of famous faces move in through the years. Among them: gold-medal figure skater Oksana Baiul, former NFL football player Bruce Elia, singer Gloria Gaynor, former member of heavy metal band Black Sabbath Ray Gillen, boxer Gus Lesnevich, the late U.S. Senator Frank Lautenberg, actor Joe Pantoliano and last – but certainly not least – health guru Dr. Mehmet Oz.

Clifton

Vera Ann Farmiga of "Bates Motel" and "The Departed" was born and raised in Clifton. David Chase, "The Sopranos" creator, grew up in Clifton and North Caldwell.

Closter

Bruce Harper, former running back and kick returner for the New York Jets, resides in town after growing up in Englewood. Harper directs the Heroes & Cool Kids foundation, which develops children into leaders.

East Orange

Malcolm Jenkins, safety for the Philadelphia Eagles, was born and raised in East Orange. Cleveland Browns safety Jabrill Peppers calls the city home. After her birth in Newark, Whitney Houston grew up in East Orange and attended Catholic school in Caldwell.

East Rutherford

Dick Vitale, ESPN basketball sportscaster was born and Passaic and grew up in East Rutherford.

Edgewater

Noteworthy names have lived in Edgewater throughout their careers, including television personality Geraldo Rivera. Former New York Yankees Robinson Cano and Chien-Ming Wang have also called the town home. TV chef Produce Pete, sportscaster John Sterling and Fox Business Network anchor Liz Claman reside here.

Englewood

Englewood was the childhood home of actor John Travolta. Author and aviatrix Anne Morrow Lindbergh was born and raised in Englewood and lived here with her husband, pioneer aviator Charles Lindbergh. Actor Richard Lewis was a native, while Charles Osgood, host of CBS Sunday Morning, spent his childhood in Englewood. The city has also been home to legendary musicians like Ben E. King, George Benson, The Isley Brothers and Sylvia Robinson, founder of Sugar Hill Records. Dizzy Gillespie settled in Englewood in 1964 and lived here until his death in 1993. Victor Wallace Farris, inventor of the paper milk carton and the paper clip, resided in Englewood.

Fairview

San Antonio Spurs forward Kyle Anderson was raised in this community.

Franklin Lakes

New York Yankees great and former New York Mets manager Willie Randolph resides here.

Garfield

Retired New York Jets wide receiver Wayne Chrebet, retired San Diego Chargers defensive tackle Luis Castillo and former Dallas Cowboys and Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver Miles Austin played football at Garfield High School.

Glen Rock

Actor Charlie Tahan grew up in Glen Rock, as did Kim Barnes Arico, head coach of women’s basketball at the University of Michigan.

Hackensack

Former Olympic figure skaters John Zimmerman and Silvia Fontana once called Hackensack home and taught at the Ice House.

Harrington Park

Omar Minaya, former general manager of the New York Mets, resides here. U.S. Senator Cory Booker grew up here. The late golf course designer, A.W. Tillinghast, noted for his work at Bethpage State Park, Ridgewood Country Club and Baltusrol Golf Club, to name a few, lived here.

Hasbrouck Heights

Actor Jason Biggs was born and raised in Hasbrouck Heights and attended Hasbrouck Heights High School. Entertainer Arthur Godfrey also lived here.

Haworth

Actress Elizabeth Gillies was born and raised in Haworth and Brooke Sheilds attended high school there.

Leonia

TV personality and foodie Anthony Bourdain grew up in Leonia and former NBA coach Phil Jackson raised his family here, as did M*A*S*H star Alan Alda.

Livingston

Jason Alexander, also known as George Costanza from "Seinfeld" was born in Newark and raised in Livingston.

Lyndhurst

Brooklyn 99 star Melissa Fumero grew up here.

Mahwah

The legendary musician and inventor of the electric guitar Les Paul called Mahwah home and was known to haunt the aisles of the local Home Depot.

Mendham

Actors Peter Dinklage of "Game of Thrones" fame and Xander Berkley, who plays Gregory on "The Walking Dead" and grew up in Mendham.

Millburn

Actress Ann Hathaway grew up in Millburn.

Montclair

NASA astronaut Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin, one of the first men to land on the moon, was raised in Montclair following his birth in Glen Ridge.

Montvale

Devils right winger Kyle Palmieri grew up in Montvale and CNN political correspondent Dana Bash was born and raised there.

Morristown

Author and political commentator Fran Lebowicz, Steve Forbes of Forbes magazine, and Derek Dryman, producer of "Spongebob Squarepants" and "Adventure Time," call Morristown home.

Newark

Actor John Amos from "Fresh Prince of Bel Air, " "West Wing" and "Good Times" was born and raised in Newark.

North Arlington

Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter spent some of his youth in North Arlington. His grandfather was the head of maintenance at Queen of Peace High School for 36 years.

Norwood

Former Yankees catcher Thurman Munson resided in Norwood during the mid-1970s. Munson played for the Yankees from 1969 until 1979, won the Golden Glove Award three years in a row and was the first captain named by the team after Lou Gehrig. ESPN SportsCenter anchor Dianna Russini grew up in Norwood and excelled in athletics at Northern Valley Regional High School –

Old Tappan.

Oradell

Oradell was home to Bill Parcells, NFL Hall of famer and former head coach of the New York Giants, New York Jets and Dallas Cowboys. Walter M. Schirra Jr., the only astronaut to fly in our nation’s first three space programs (Mercury, Gemini and Apollo) was also a longtime resident.

Paramus

Clueless actress Stacey Dash was born in the borough, as was Olympic figure skater Elaine Zayak.

Park Ridge

The community is known for high-profile occupants, such as former New York Giants head coach Tom Coughlin and former president Richard M. Nixon. The late James Gandolfini, star of The Sopranos, grew up here, as did former model and actress Karen Duffy.

Passaic

The Shirelles members Shirley Alston Reeves (nee, Owens), Doris Kenner-Jackson (nee, Coley), Addie "Micki" Harris McFadden and Beverly Lee grew up in Passaic.

Paterson

Mike Adams, safety for the Indianapolis Colts and Arizona Cardinals head coach Bruce Arians, rapper Fetty Wap and Giants wide receiver Victor Cruz grew up in Paterson.

Ridgefield Park

Ridgefield Park was the childhood home of Ozzie Nelson, the star, writer and director of The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet, the second longest-running family sitcom in television history.

Ridgewood

Mystery novelist Harlan Coben makes a home here, while comedian Andy Daly, political commentator Guy Benson, actor Michael Zegen and novelist Patricia Engel all grew up in the village. Famed musician Nelson Riddle went to Ridgewood High and Oscar-winning film editor Thelma Schoonmaker called the village home. And what would TV’s House be without his esteemed colleague Dr. Watson – we mean Wilson – Ridgewood’s own Robert Sean Leonard.

Teaneck

The list of famous people from Teaneck is nearly endless, but here’s a sample of the Who’s Who of the community.

Paramus: Teen credits Tom Petty for his budding career in music

Celebrities: Tenafly's Mira Sorvino says she was a Weinstein victim

Movies: 5 recent films taped in North Jersey

Fashion designer Marc Jacobs, character actors Philip Bosco and Paul Sorvino, Sesame Street’s Bob McGrath, musicians Ben E. King and Phoebe Snow, former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Peter Pace, former MLB player Doug Glanville and former New York Knicks player Tony Campbell all called Teaneck home.

Tenafly

Anchorwoman Lori Stokes of ABC’s Eyewitness News calls Tenafly home. Actors Lea Michele, star of Glee and Scream Queens, Mira Sorvino, Jay Hughley and Alexie Gilmore spent their childhoods in the community. Actor Tate Donovan also called Tenafly home growing up.

West Milford

Donna Weinbrecht, Olympic gold medal winner for freestyle skiing, Steve Jobs wife, Emerson Collective founder Laurene Powell Jobs, Lennie Friedman, former NFL linebacker and former Cincinnati Bengals linebacker, Kevin Walker grew up in West Milford. Larry Hand, formerly of the Detroit Lions was born in Paterson, but grew up in West Milford.

Westwood

Chicago Cubs third baseman Tommy LaStella was born in Westwood and grew up in Closter.

Wyckoff

Nick, Frankie, Joe and Kevin Jonas – aka the Jonas Brothers – grew up in Wyckoff, as did professional golfer Morgan Hoffman and professional football player Brian Toal. American Pie actress Tara Reid grew up in Wyckoff and famed NY Yankee Bucky Dent also called the town home.
